chunks.zh: 编程入门什么时候都不晚。

chunks.zh: 很不看好鸿蒙，不管是手机还是电脑，自建生态的鸿蒙是不可能成功的，不要浪费时间在这种没有意义的事情上。

chunks.zh: 学什么适合你我不知道，但我知道鸿蒙不值得学

chunks.zh: 你这个背景程序员这条路并不好走，但感觉电工还可以
chunks.en: With your background, the path of a programmer is not easy, but I feel that being an electrician is okay.

chunks.zh: 抛弃现在的思维, 找个方向扎进去, 不然三五年过去甚至更久才幡然醒悟, 这是九成想学计算机的误区.
chunks.en: Abandon your current thinking, find a direction and dig into it, otherwise it will take three or five years or even longer to wake up. This is the misunderstanding of 90% of people who want to learn computer science.

chunks.zh: 想用这个赚钱，推荐还是学 java 。
chunks.en: If you want to make money from this, I recommend learning Java.

chunks.zh: 不过这行说是简单，其实也没那么简单，很多基础理论还是要学的，不然实际工作中很多事情会想不明白为什么是这个样子。
chunks.en: But although this industry is said to be simple, it's actually not that simple. You still have to learn a lot of basic theories, otherwise you won't understand why things are the way they are in actual work.

chunks.zh: 如果自己弄着玩，python 挺好的，实现很多功能都很方便，资料也很多
chunks.en: If you're just doing it for fun, Python is good. It's very convenient to implement many functions, and there's a lot of information available.

chunks.zh: 至于鸿蒙，建议别费心思在这上面，你还不如去学 web 三件套
chunks.en: As for HarmonyOS, I suggest you don't bother with it. You might as well learn the web three-piece suite.

chunks.zh: emmmmmmmmmmm...我是不建议你朝着吃这碗饭的方向去学，因为无底洞太深，连已经是很少数的正经科班训练自主探索了 4 年的毕业生也很难说可以达到商业软件开发者的水平，更别说闲着有空学的了。
chunks.en: emmmmmmmmmmm... I don't recommend you learn in the direction of making a living from this, because the bottomless pit is too deep. Even the few graduates who have received formal training and explored independently for 4 years can hardly be said to have reached the level of commercial software developers, let alone those who learn in their spare time.

chunks.zh: 如果只是想编程解决日常小问题的话那么 python 挺合适的，如果你想朝「入行的方向」多探索一点，那么建议学学 javascript 做点有界面有交互的东西，或者啃啃 C++ 买几块 arduino / esp32 玩；
chunks.en: If you just want to program to solve small daily problems, then Python is quite suitable. If you want to explore a little more in the 'entering the industry' direction, then I suggest you learn JavaScript to make something with an interface and interaction, or study C++ and buy a few Arduino / ESP32 to play with.

chunks.zh: 如果真想「入行」，那早日放弃这个想法……
chunks.en: If you really want to 'enter the industry', then give up on this idea as soon as possible...

chunks.zh: 这种人生路线问题最好不在这里问，去知 h ，能得到很多中肯的建议，不过我还是想先打击你一下1.
chunks.en: It's best not to ask about this kind of life path here. Go to Zhihu, you can get a lot of pertinent advice, but I still want to hit you first. 1.

chunks.zh: 首先你学历不过关，基本的简历关就过不了，大数据就基本不用想了，我不是学历歧视之类的，当然有无学历的程序猿大牛，但是这种人万中无一，除非你自信你自己就是，不然还是走别的路吧
chunks.en: First of all, your education doesn't meet the standards, and you can't pass the basic resume screening. You don't even need to think about big data. I'm not being discriminatory based on education, etc. Of course, there are great programmers without degrees, but such people are one in a million, unless you're confident that's you, otherwise you should take another path.

chunks.zh: 从你的文字中来看，你对入行的想法不坚定，甚至有些退缩，这样的人我见过，我劝他放弃别的想法，全身心投入刻苦去学，他总是借口说我就学着玩玩，万一成了呢，放心，成不了的，你基本没有底子，也没有决心信念，不说写代码，换成其他任何事都不可能有成绩，即便找个传统行业公司开发岗拿着几千的工资做着兼修电脑的活，也只是在浪费你年轻的资本，没有任何提升
chunks.en: Judging from your words, you are not firm in your idea of entering the industry, and you are even a little hesitant. I have seen people like this. I advised him to give up other ideas and devote himself wholeheartedly to studying hard. He always excuses himself by saying that he is just learning for fun, and what if he succeeds? Don't worry, he won't succeed. You have basically no foundation, no determination or belief. Not to mention writing code, you can't achieve anything in any other matter, even if you find a development position in a traditional industry company with a salary of a few thousand and also repair computers, you are just wasting the capital of your youth, and there is no improvement.
